location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from George Lucas, on board HMS Berenice, Bombay Harbour, to Lewis Pelly, Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire

mods.abstract: Letter regarding an Indian man and a small boy who were brought to Bombay from Muskat [Muscat] on board the Berenicein order to prevent the boy from being sold and seeking advice from Pelly on how to handle the situation.The letter goes on to outline a second situation in which the Muskat Apothecary and some of the engineers from the Berenicehad attempted to arrange for some women from the former Sultan (Thuwaini bin Said)'s Harem to be smuggled out of Muscat which the Sultan (Salim II bin Thuwaini) became aware of.
